name: Bourbon Old Fashioned
text:
In an old fashioned glass, dash the bitters on to the sugar cube. Add the orange wheel and cherry. Muddle well. 
Fill glass with ice cubes, add bourbon, stir.

Really quite nice with Bulleit.

name: Stiletto, Gary's Version
text:
Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Not going to be a favorite.

name: Dirty Daiquiri
text:
Shake well with ice. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

The demerara syrup mutes the rum but adds a caramel dimension.

name: Martinez, Gary's Version
text:
Stir and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust bitters to taste (and modify recipe). Add garnish.

Check DeGroff's version!

name: Monkey Gland, Gary's No. 1
text: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust benedictine and grenadine (and modify recipe).

name: Papa Doble
text: Blend with ice. Pour into a coupe glass and serve without garnish.

name: Stiletto, Mr. Boston's Version
text:
Pour into ice-filled old fashioned glass and stir.

Probably better with DiSaronno, and can probably use more than 1/4 ounce of it. Also probably better shaken, and maybe in a cocktail glass.

name: Jack Rose, Dale's Version
text:
Shake with ice, strain over ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with apple slice and a maraschino cherry.

Smooth, easy drinking, likely to be a crowd pleaser. Sweet but balanced.

name: Jockey Club Cocktail No. 2
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust bitters to taste (and modify recipe).

name: Martini, Saint Toad's Last Chance
text:
Stir vigorously with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into chilled martini glass. Garnish with a pitted Castelvetrano Olive

Finally, a martini that I do not hate. 4:1 ratio. Also works well in a 2:1 ratio, and happily takes a drop or two of Regan's Orange Bitters.

name: Bijou, Ritz Version
text:
Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass, garnish with cherry.

Nice and dry with Junipero, Grand Marnier, and Vya.

name: Oriental Cocktail
text: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Satan's Whiskers
text: Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange peel.

name: Southside
text:
Caribbean style!

Set aside part of the lemon peel for garnish.

In a glass, thoroughly mix the sugar, gin, and lemon juice. Gently muddle 1 sprig of mint. Add ice and stir until glass is frosty. Add highly-carbonated club soda and stir a little more.

Garnish with the remaining sprig of mint and lemon garnish.

name: White Lady
text:
Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

A little tart, great aftertaste. Nice with North Shore No. 11. Try with other gins!

name: Hawaiian Cocktail
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Kentucky Colonel
text:
Stir with ice in a mixing glass, strain into a chilled cocktail glass or over ice in a rocks glass.

Thick mouthfeel from the benedictine. Can take a lot of bitters. Kind of burny, probably depends on the spirit.

name: Mamie Taylor
text: Squeeze juice from lemon wedge into a highball glass, add the wedge. Add ice, scotch, ginger ale and stir briefly.

name: AK-BC
text: Shake with ice, strain into chilled goblet.

name: Monkey Gland, Gary's No. 2
text:
Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust pernod/absinthe and grenadine (and modify recipe).

Seems like too much gin. Not offensive, but not exactly memorable.

name: Old Fashioned
text:
In an old fashioned glass, dash the bitters on to the sugar cube. Add the orange slice and cherry. Muddle well. 
Fill glass with ice cubes, add rye, stir.

Really quite nice with Old West Rendezvous Rye.

name: Ward Nine
text:
Shake with ice, strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish with cherry.

Do not use a small old fashioned glass! A very nice drink to highlight Rendezvous Rye.

name: California Gimlet
text:
Shake with ice, strain into old fashioned glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

Great with Junipero.

name: Teresa
text:
Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Bracingly citrus, intriguingly musty aroma, balanced and weird.

name: Vieux Carre
text:
Build over ice in a rocks glass. Stir.

Use good quality brandy.

name: Hemingway Daiquiri, Dale's Version
text:
Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Great with 10 Cane, great with Oronoco. Very smooth, balanced, refreshing. Grapefruit is quite subtle, no tartness from the lime. 

Simple Syrup can be reduced to 1/2 ounce, maybe less. Maple syrup makes a wonderful substitute for simple syrup.

name: Mai Tai
text:
Fill double old fashioned glass with crushed ice. Dump ice and other ingredients into shaker. Shake vigorously. Dump shaker contents into glass.

Garnish with lime shell and spanked mint leaves.

Jamaican = Appleton Estates 12
Demerara = El Dorado 12
Curaçao = Senior Orange Colored
Orgeat = Small Hand Foods

name: Between The Sheets, Dale's Version
text:
Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass, garnish with flamed orange peel.

Not so great with Torres, seems unbalanced, too tart, too cointreau dominant.

name: Bacardi Cocktail, Ritz Version
text: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Singapore Sling
text:
Shake with ice, strain into a highball glass, garnish with orange slice and cherry.

Smooth, integrated. No taste whatsoever of alcohol, no gin bite or Cointreau edge. Tastes largely of pineapple. Try to get fresh pineapple juice (somehow).

name: Meyer Fitzgerald
text: Shake with ice, strain over ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with lemon wedge.

name: Preakness Cocktail
text: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust benedictine and bitters to taste.

name: Stork Club Cocktail
text: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled coctail glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel. Orange bitters or Angostura recommended.

name: Ti' punch
text:
Put the syrup into a large rocks glass. Squeeze the lime wedge thoroughly into the syrup, then drop it in. Add the rhum, and an ice cube. Stir and let sit before drinking.

Great with Batiste. 

Don't skimp on the syrup otherwise the lime will easily dominate and throw things out of balance.

Don't pay too much attention to measurements. Just mix it up and let the Trade Winds cool your heels.

name: Gin Fizz
text: Shake with ice, strain into an ice filled highball glass. Fill with club soda (1 to 2 ounces, to taste).

name: 3 by 5
text: Shake into chilled cocktail glass

name: Aviation
text:
Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass (adjust ratio depending on dryness of liqueur).

Tons of juniper with North Shore No. 11, worth trying with sweeter gins. More of a 3.5 than a 3.

name: Bennett Cocktail
text: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Adjust bitters to taste.

name: Deadly Sin
text:
Stir with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the garnish.

Not a bad way to enjoy some bourbon, but bourbon is better served in an Old Fashioned.

name: El Floridita No. 1
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust Luxardo to taste (and then modify this recipe!)

name: English Rose
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled sugar rimmed cocktail glass. Adjust grenadine to taste (and modify recipe).

name: John Collins
text: Shake with ice, strain into an iced 10-14 ounce collins glass and fill with soda. Garnish with cherry and orange slice.

name: Leap Year Cocktail
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Add garnish.

name: Old Flame
text: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with flamed orange peel.

name: Bobby Burns
text: Stir with ice in a mixing glass, strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve with shortbread on the side.

name: Sazerac
text:
Fill a small rocks glass with ice. In another rocks glass, muddle the sugar cube and the Peychaud's bitters (and optional water). 
Dump the ice from the first glass, and coat the inside with absinthe, pouring out the excess. strain the cocktail into the absinthe glass.
twist the lemon over the glass, and optionally drop into the drink.

name: Delmarva Cocktail No. 3
text:
Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Seems too dry to balance the lemon. Used Lazzaroni amaretto, perhaps a sweeter amaretto would balance things out. Still, quite pleasant.

name: Gin Rickey
text: Stir with ice in a short highball or a rocks glass. Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Montara Sunset
text:
Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass, or over ice in a rocks glass. 

Lime juice may be omitted.

name: Beachcomber Cocktail
text:
Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Well that's different. Great with Oronoco. Not great with 10 Cane. Needs an unassertive rum to highlight the luxardo/cointreau combo.

name: Presbyterian
text: Build over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with lemon peel. Note: Regan's version has the measures of soda and bourbon reversed, and calls for rye instead of bourbon.

name: El Presidente, Gary's Version
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Ward Eight
text:
Shake with ice, strain over ice into an old fashioned glass and garnish with cherry.

Do not use a small old fashioned glass! A very nice drink to highlight Rendezvous Rye.

name: Yakuza Godfather (Oyabun)
text: Build over ice in a rocks glass. Stir.

name: Hop Toad Cocktail
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust bitters to taste (and modify recipe).

name: Lewis & Martin Cocktail
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Add garnish.

name: Missing Link
text: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Tart Gin Cooler
text: Build in an ice-filled collins glass, adjust bitters to taste.

name: Margarita
text:
Salt the rim of the glass:
Slot a lime and with the glass upside down, apply lime juice to the rim, not necessarily the entire glass.
Apply the OUTSIDE of the glass to a plate of kosher salt.
Refrigerate the glass.

Shake ingredients with ice, strain into glass.

Can be prepared in a margarita or cocktail glass, or over ice in a rocks glass.

Good with Espolon Reposado.
Not great with Tres Generaciones Plato.

Gary's versionuses 1/2 ounce lime juice, worth trying.

name: Pegu Club Cocktail
text: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust both bitters to taste.

name: Black Feather Cocktail
text: Stir with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the garnish. Adjust bitters to taste.

name: Sling
text: Shake with ice, strain over ice into a collins glass, top with soda, and garnish with lime peel (preferably a spiral)

name: Jack Rose, Gary's Version
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust grenadine to taste (and modify recipe). Garnish with lemon twist.

name: Port-Whiskey Punch
text: Shake all but the port with ice. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice, top with the port, garnish with the orange slice and lemon twist.

name: Modernista
text:
Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Add the garnishes. Adjust pernod/absinthe and bitters (and modify recipe).

Used Bruichladdish, Appleton 12, and 1/4 oz pernod, and it's awful.

name: Queen's Park Swizzle
text:
Add ingredients and shell of the lime you just juiced into a tall glass. 
Fill the glass with crushed ice and swizzle until the glass frosts over. 

Garnish with a large sprig of mint. Serve with a straw.

Excellent with El Dorado 15.
Worth trying a substitute of sirop de canne for the simple syrup.

name: Bronx Cocktail, Dale's Version
text: Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange peel.

name: Tom Collins
text: Shake with ice, strain into an iced 10-14 ounce collins glass and fill with soda. Garnish with cherry and orange slice.

name: Fitzgerald
text:
Shake with ice, strain over ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with lemon wedge

Exceptional with Angostura and North Shore No. 11, good with Greylock.

name: Grape Dogg
text: shake with ice, strain into a crushed-ice filled collins glass. lay back, and put your mind on your money.

name: Bacardi Cocktail
text: Shake with ice, strain into a small cocktail glass.

name: Mouresque Cocktail
text:
Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass, or serve in an ice filled highball topped with water.

Unusual! Great with Small Hands Foods Orgeat + Pernod, but that's no reason not to play around with other options.

Weird color, weird texture, strongly fennelly. Jarringly refreshing. Possibly cloying, but maybe just on the border.

Original recipe calls for orgeat syrup, so try using that, or alter to add sweetness.

Original recipe calls for absinthe substitute, so be sure to try with pernod, etc.

name: Between The Sheets
text: Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Orange Blossom
text: Shake with ice and strain into a small chilled cocktail glass, or a stemmed goblet. Garnish with orange peel, preferably spiral (degroff 154).

name: Remember The Maine
text:
Stir, clockwise, with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust bitters and absinthe to taste.

Original recipe calls for absinthe substitute, so be sure to try with pernod, etc.

name: Daiquiri
text:
Shake well with ice. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Rums to use: Batiste, 10 Cane, Oronoco

name: Laid Back
text: shake with ice, serve in chilled rocks glass. garnish artistically.

name: Maiden's Blush Cocktail
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust grenadine to taste (and modify recipe).

name: Manhattan
text: Stir whisky, vermouth and bitters in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into chilled cocktail glass, garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Americano
text:
Pour vermouth and Campari into ice-filled highball, top with club soda to taste. Garnish with orange slice.

Don't use a citrusy vermouth (like Vya), since the Campari provides plenty of citrus peel. Don't use Dolin, it is too wimpy to offset the Campari.

name: Big Pine Tree Cocktail
text: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the garnish.

name: Maurice Cocktail
text: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust pernod/absinthe to taste (and modify recipe). Add garnish.

name: Monkey Gland, Dale's Version
text: Splash the absinthe into a mixing glass. Add ingredients and shake with ice. Strain into small cocktail glass and garnish with orange peel.

name: Rob Roy
text:
Stir with ice in a mixing glass, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with lemon peel.

Adjust bitters to taste.

name: Bronx Cocktail, Gary's Version
text: Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Bitters to taste. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Valentino
text: Shake and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Grog, Dale's Version
text: Stir, serve over ice in a short stemmed goblet, or use boiling water for a hot drink and serve in a mug.

name: Income Tax Cocktail
text:
Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust bitters to taste (and modify recipe). Garnish with orange twist.

Not great, not bad. Strongly gin flavored (surprise), don't go easy on the bitters and use plenty of very sweet vermouth.

name: Maple Bourbon Esmash
text: Chill a martini glass. Cut an orange wedge and set aside some lemon peel for garnish. Shake everything but the seltzer. Gently stir in the seltzer. Strain into chilled glasses, garnish.

name: Bee's Knees
text: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with flamed lemon peel.

name: Negroni
text: Stir with ice in a rocks glass.

name: Bolero Cocktail
text: Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Scofflaw
text: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass, adjust bitters to taste.

name: Chanticleer Cocktail
text: Shake with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: French Gimlet
text: Shake with ice, strain into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with lime wedge or peel.

name: Whiskey Sour
text:
Shake and strain into chilled sour glass or ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with cherry and orange wheel.

Great with Redemption Rye. When in the mood, add some bitters.

name: Maiden's Prayer Cocktail
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Adjust bitters to taste (and modify recipe).

name: Mojito
text:
Cut a wheel off the lime for garnish. Cut the lime into 4 wedges. In a rocks glass, muddle the sugar and the lime. Stir well to dissolve sugar.

Add the mint leaves (about 10), and bruise them gently. Add the rhum, fill to top with crushed ice. Top off with club soda. Attach shaker and shake. 

Garnish with a lime wheel and a sprig of slapped mint.

(Mixing is the key. Experiment with different mixing methods (stir instead of shake, etc).)

Pint glass works. Adjust rhum volume depending on rhum strength.

name: Blood And Sand
text:
Shake with ice, strain into cocktail glass and garnish with the orange peel.

Elegant, smooth! Dolin and Yamazaki. Try more assertive scotch to toss it just a little out of balance. Could be a 5 with proper OJ.

Takes well to a peaty scotch like Bruichladdich Blue Bottle, needs assertive scotch to balance the overly sweet OJ and cherry.

Can be a temperamental cocktail.

Pairs exceptionally well with dark chocolate.

Try with Vya!

name: Cleveland Steamer
text:
shake and strain into chilled rocks glass. garnish is unacceptable!

should go well with nutmeg, clove, ginger, capsicum, or other spicy spice.

name: Dark and Stormy
text:
Pour the rum over ice in a highball. Fill with ginger beer. Squeeze in lime wedge.

Great with El Dorado 12 and Bundaberg ginger beer.

Seems very difficult to get the proportions just right: it can very easily taste like a bad rum and coke.

Original recipe calls for Gosling's or other "bitter rum", but I find it swell with El Dorado. Seems highly variable.

name: El Presidente, Rumdood's Version
text: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange or lemon twist.
